definition: to equivocate/to talk evasively (idiom)
to keep/to contain/to suck (keep in your mouth without chewing)
congee/making a living
variant of 糊[hu2]
muddled/paste/scorched
paste/cream
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
old variant of 詞|词[ci2]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: To talk or act insincerely or misleadingly; equivocate .
sentences.chinese: 支吾，搪塞不说真话，含糊其词。

sentences.english: The problem here is one of equivocation.
sentences.chinese: 这是个含糊其词的问题。

sentences.english: Reporter sends a telegram to the Hangzhou many bold vehicle brands, mostly talks ambiguously not to be willing to state clearly.
sentences.chinese: 记者致电杭州多家豪车品牌，大多含糊其词不愿明说。

sentences.english: Equivocation is Number1 cousin to a lie.

sentences.chinese: 有话直说，不许你含糊其词。

sentences.english: He had talked vaguely of going to work abroad.
sentences.chinese: 他含糊其词地说了到国外工作的事。

sentences.english: Arafat immediately began to equivocate, asking for clarifications.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉法特立即开始含糊其词，要求对条款加以解释。
政府的含糊其词让丑闻更恶化。

sentences.english: A little overwhelmed, I began the generalized evasions which that question deserves.
sentences.chinese: 我有点不知所措，就开始说一些含糊其词的话来搪塞。

sentences.english: They agreed as to the grand outlines, but quibbled over particulars.
sentences.chinese: 他们对重大要点表示同意，但对细节却含糊其词。

sentences.english: The spokesman slurred over the matter without giving a straight answer.
sentences.chinese: 发言人对这件事不置可否，含糊其词。

sentences.english: This kind of obscurity is not only pretensions; it is short-sighted .
sentences.chinese: 这种含糊其词不仅显得自命不凡，而且缺乏远见。

sentences.english: This excuse is vague, but also difficult to refute.
sentences.chinese: 这个借口含糊其词，但也难以反驳。

definition: to speak evasively (idiom); beating about the bush
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
(of speech) obscure/unclear/(of actions) vague/ineffectual
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to respond evasively or vaguely/to elude/to stall
to resist/to deal with
the king looked left and right and then talked of other things/to digress from the topic of discussion (idiom)
pinyin: wang2 gu4 zuo3 you4 er2 yan2 ta1

definition: (idiom) to talk in a roundabout way to cover up the truth/evasive
to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
to muddle through/to fob sb off/to beat around the bush/to dodge
to offer excuses (colloquial)/to stall
vague/unclear/ambiguous
(idiom) to sidestep the question/to answer evasively
to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
equivocal/ambiguous
(idiom) half true and half false
